definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
Kangxi radical 105, known as 登字頭|登字头[deng1 zi4 tou2]
to happen/to occur/to take place/to break out
to exploit (a resource)/to open up (for development)/to develop
to release/to issue/to announce/to distribute/also written 發布|发布[fa1 bu4]
to display/to exhibit/to bring out implicit or innate qualities/to express (a thought or moral)/to develop (an idea)/to elaborate (on a theme)
to publish/to issue (stocks, currency etc)/to release/to distribute (a film)
to issue (an order, decree etc)/to send out/to dispatch/to produce (a sound)/to let out (a laugh)
to lead to/to trigger/to initiate/to cause/to evoke (emotions)

sentences.english: Car fans always post this kind of articles.
There was no relapse after radical operation.
sentences.chinese: 行根治性手術切除後，未見覆發。

sentences.english: When Sun Quan reached the city walls, arrows rained down on him, and one struck his plumed helmet.
sentences.chinese: 權自到城下看時，城上箭如雨發，射中孫權麾蓋。

sentences.english: If you order in the morning, we have more than four hours.
sentences.chinese: 如果你是在白天發的訂單，就會超過四個小時。

sentences.english: A little leaven leaveneth the whole lump.
sentences.chinese: 一點面酵能使全團都發起來。

sentences.english: EMMA NORTHEY: "The children were each given a passport."
sentences.chinese: 每個孩子都發了一個護照。

sentences.english: The e-mail you sent yesterday was returned as undeliverable.
sentences.chinese: 你昨天發的郵件被退回來了。

sentences.english: Had a Cowlick In Its Hair…And Didn't Pull a Face When Photographed.
sentences.chinese: 發一團糟，拍照的時候也沒有做鬼臉。

sentences.english: Apply solution to the tube and allow to become tacky .
sentences.chinese: 在內胎上塗抹膠水並讓它發粘。

sentences.english: Can’t that email wait a few hours?
sentences.chinese: 那封電子郵件不能等幾小時發嗎？

sentences.english: Know ye not that a little leaven leaveneth the whole lump?
sentences.chinese: 豈不知一點面酵能使全團發起來嗎。

sentences.english: Next year peach and plum trees will be in bloom again
sentences.chinese: 桃李明年能再發，明歲閨中知是誰？

sentences.english: He tucked my hair behind my ear and gave me a half smile.
sentences.chinese: 他撩起我耳朵後頭發，咧着嘴微微一笑。

sentences.english: Sometimes I have nightmares about God.
sentences.chinese: 有時我會發一些關於神的夢。

sentences.english: As you may know, I send out a “Success Tip” every Sunday to those of you who have signed-up to receive my success tips.
sentences.chinese: 我每週末發一條“成功祕訣”給那些已經簽約的人。

sentences.english: But God was very angry when he went, and the angel of the Lord stood in the road to oppose him.
sentences.chinese: 神因他去就發了怒，耶和華的使者站在路上敵擋他。

definition: to stick/to paste/to post (e.g. on a blog)/to keep close to/to fit snugly/to subsidize/allowance (e.g. money for food or housing)/sticker/classifier for sticking plaster: strip
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
should/ought to/probably/must be/to deserve/to owe/to be sb's turn to do sth/that/the above-mentioned
pertaining to/concerning/with regard to/about/a matter of
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
still/still in progress/still more/yet/even more/in addition/fairly/passably (good)/as early as/even/also/else
